learning_outcomes.description: Integrate the knowledge you have gained from your industry experience into your own professional identity
Contextualise the knowledge you have gained
Engage in a collaborative manner whilst demonstrating initiative in working independently
Engage actively in critical self-reflection and self-evaluation
Communicate, present and behave in a professional manner

assessments.task_description:
Prepare and present an oral presentation during a conference held at UQ Dutton Park campus after completing the placement. Approval may be sought from the course coordinator to attend and present through video conference. The presentation should include a PowerPoint slide set (or equivalent). This assessment is marked by a panel of academics and representatives of the organisation. See Learn.UQ (Blackboard) for details, presentation schedule, and marking criteria.

This presentation will be recorded and retained as per university policy. The recording will be stored in a secure manner and will only be accessed if required for the purposes of moderation of marking; provision of feedback to the student; and/or re-marking following a successful re-mark application.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Give your oral presentation at the scheduled time - see Learn.UQ (Blackboard) for details.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description: Prepare a report detailing the environmental scan that you will perform in the context of your placement. Note that students returning to the same site for a second placement will create a report on a different topic, personalised to your placement environment. See Learn.UQ (Blackboard) for details of this assessment and marking criteria.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit via the link provided in Learn.UQ (Blackboard).
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Performance Evaluations are conducted on TWO occasions: mid-way through the placement and at the end of the placement, with due dates that are specified in your personalised assessment schedule. The performance evaluation is conducted by your supervisor in your workplace, or the person with designated authority on their behalf, and is intended to form part of a conversation with them regarding your performance.

Students must initiate the process by emailing supervisors directly through ePortfolio; you may be required to enter supervisor contact details. The due dates are in your personalised assessment schedule and your submissions through ePortfolio must be made by that date. The submission from your supervisor (or nominee) will be automated through ePortfolio and is not subject to a submission deadline, however students are advised to ensure supervisors return the evaluation, failure to do so can result in delays in grading. This assessment item is not a test but is an evaluation of your performance against the criteria.

A feedback action plan is to be conducted with the mid performance evaluation only; after receiving the evaluation you will decide on your actions.

The performance evaluations and feedback action plan contribute 5% for the mid review and 10% for the final review = 15%. See Learn.UQ (Blackboard) for more information and marking criteria.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit through the ePortfolio system via the link provided in Learn.UQ (Blackboard).
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
There are a total of 10 reflections to complete during your placement. You are required to complete at least SIX of these across the entire placement course. Specific due dates are spaced at intervals and these dates are indicated within your personalised assessment schedule. Four of these (reflections A, B, C and D) are compulsory and must be completed by the specified date. You may select two reflections from the rest, and undertake them in any order as long as you meet the due dates. Each reflection is due within 7 days of the date nominated in your personalised assessment schedule.

These assessment items are completed by the student and assessed by the university; students may wish to seek input from their supervisors as to the content. See Learn.UQ (Blackboard) for details and marking criteria.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit through the ePortfolio system via the link in Learn.UQ (Blackboard).
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date: Initial completion by end of week 4 of placement, with updates through semester.
assessments.task_description: This is a living document, it should be initially completed by the due date, and then updated as activities change over the course of the placement. Changes could also be made due to circumstances within the organisation or the workflow.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submission is via the link provided in Learn.UQ (Blackboard).
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
Industry Placement

Placements are generally designed to be attended on a full time basis, usually weekdays and 5 days per week. Expectations around placement length and attendance will be communicated by the placement site. These are professional environments with expectations set by the site; poor engagement and/or attendance may result in penalties including termination of the placement site and associated outcomes in line with fitness to study policy.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
